column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8:
Owned this wireless over-the-ear headset for use in the noisy underground T or subway system commute, for almost a year, and can confidently say the following:
PROS:
- comfortable and somewhat adjustable for ours of listening - fit my head and wrapped around my ears well (but if you have a big head/ears, this may be a problem)
- durable - headset band is rubberized material and not cheap/flimsy hard plastic (bend and stretch and no scary cracking sounds)
- decent bass - bass is okay, not good/great, but if you use Android apps VLC or Equalizer and up the volume and bass, you get a pretty good result
- price is reasonable, not like the overpriced popular brands and you can confidently buy versus the no-name brands (that are dirt-cheap or reasonably inexpensive, but the quality is questionable)
- battery life is very good and charge time is very fast
- seconds as ear-muffs during the cold/windy winters
- much better than in-ear or ear-bud headsets at drowning out external noise, but no substitute for noise-cancellation systems
- bluetooth connectivity is good and reliable (audio tips tell you when the headset is connected)
- headset amplifier (via volume buttons) works very well and combined with the volume on your phone, you can get plenty of sounds for most listeners

CONS:
- comfortable ear cushions means they are not dense enough to insulate/isolate exterior noise (screeching noise of the train wheels against the metal rails pierces right through the headset, even when you crank the sound up)
- comfortable on your head, but not when you wear it around your neck temporarily (cannot turn your head down without the big round ear pieces in your way)
- seasonal, i.e. great in the Winter and Fall, but will make you sweat in the Summer (but I guess all over-the-ear headsets will do so)
- no guide that tells you how much charge is left

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8:
So I reviewed the Skullcandy uproar not too long ago and exchanged it towards purchasing the Hesh2 Wireless (at best buy).
Bottom paragraph is the vedict (summary).

The uproar was fairly painful compared to the Hesh 2. The sound is great and that's nothing new with Skullcandy since they have always given quality sound. Bass isn't too big which isn't a big deal for me since I'm not bass heavy. The button for turning on the device is at a rather not so smart spot. The uproar had better positions when it came to the buttons, MUCH better positions. At least the plus and minus button are at good positions. All in all the sound quality delivers as Skullcandy products have always done.

Wireless is a bonus for me so I don't have to deal with a cable infront of me as I'm writing down notes.

So why the 2 stars? Comfort. I've been studying all day and my head hurts wearing these. And me wearing glasses doesn't affect the comfort because I had them off for 2 hours and no difference. When I take the Hesh 2 off my head feels relieved from the release of pressure. I honestly don't understand why there needs to be so much grip on the head. No the "Memory foam" does NOT help at all. Not only that my ears do feel odd with the size of the ear pillows. seriously ear is just large enough to be at the rim. I put the top of my ear in the hole while my ear lobe gets pressure from the pillow. Why couldn't Skullcandy make the hole a little larger is beyond me or even make the headphone a little larger so that it really is around my ear instead on part on ear part off. it's not comfy at all. I don't know what size their ears are but they should take into account the shape of the ear which is more vertical than circular.

This could have been a seriously good product but it isn't . Even with the sound being the high quality that is expected from skullcandy, the comfort just kills it all. Being on halfway and off halfway isn't comfortable not to mention pressure on the head tight cause aches over time. As a college student who spends a lot of time studying while listening to music comfort is a MUST. I've worn these headphones all day today and I'm rather dissapointed. If skullcandy does put out comfortable wireless headphones that are around-ear I'll be there asap to get one and try it but right now there isn't something like that in the market.

The only negative I have is that I feel like the side of my head is a beacon. Kinda tacky, but the light bothers me.

column7: Great cans for a very reasonable price.  Don't mess around with wires anymore!
column8:
These are a super good value for the price.

I don't have access to bluetooth Bose headphones, but I do have access to the wired sound reducing Bose headphones.  While we cannot compare apples to apples here, I can tell you that I am CONFIDENT in saying that you can get better sound quality out of these cans versus the Bose equivalents that are around four times the price.

They don't actively cancel noise, but they sound great.

They will not blow you away with fake bass, but rather provide a rich and balanced sound across the spectrum.  I think you will be very happy with this purchase, if you purchase this product.

The range is good, the quality is great, and the sound quality is above what I would have expected for the price - though with the brand I did expect decent sound.  Battery hasn't died on me yet, haven't had them a week, but so far so good!

I will update this review if anything changes, but these headphones are on my list of "recommended purchases".

I take the time to write these reviews, and I would appreciate a quick click  below if they help you in any way with your purchasing decision.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: BY DESIGN,  WIRED  SHOULD  BEAT  BLUETOOTH 2  IT'S  A  BANDWIDTH  THING!
column8:
I want to clear up a misconception about Bluetooth sound quality complaints. I keep reading reviews that complain that these phones sound better through their wired connection than they sound through Bluetooth. Well kids, that's very predictable since this class of bluetooth implementation has a frequency response that tops out at 15K on the high end. They SHOULD sound better through their alternate wire-connect. FM radio tops out at 15K also. That's why your CDs (20-20,000 cycles) sound better than your FM.  15K is the 'Brickwall' limit. A friend let me try his Hesh. Not bad!

The fact that these Hesh 2's sound better through the wire is actually a compliment to these phones. It means that the speakers themselves are capable of better frequency response, themselves. The fact that I keep reading these complaints is actually a plus. Knowing that, if you really want to do some Critical listening, plug 'em in & rock out. I'm still reading reviews, but am regular Amazon customer, & retired recording engineer. This is probably the pair I will get.  Also 15K will actually help save you hearing...high frequency hearing can be the first to go. Save yer ears, buy 'em!!!

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8:
**Updated review*** I was dissatisfied with the charging port on these headphones and have  been trying, for two years going on three to find headphones at the same price (or less) with as high quality sound. It has been frustrating as hell. And the Hesh 2 remains clearly the best sounding headphone around the $70 mark. I keep getting suckered by glowing reviews for less expensive products. Leme (incredible for the price with one big flaw... much too quiet) The MPOW (garbage) and the Avantree 40hr audition (great headphones for the price, but they make me miserable because they don't have the hesh 2 quality sound.) I think I'm going to bite the bullet and buy another pair of Hesh 2. Or wait for skull candy to design over  ear headphones with  long battery life. If Avantree can do it for cheap, it can't be long before other manufacturers follow suit.

Below is my old review: It remains accurate. If your bottom line is sound I think you should strongly consider these headphones. And they've moved the charging port to a better spot (and hopefully improved the build on it). I still hate micro usb but everyone seems to use them (love the wireless charging on phones... but that's another review ;).

*******

Pros: excellent sound, 12hr battery life. easy pairing. simple controls.

Minor Con:Minor Con: Big ear cups. The ear cups stick way out, They're actually pretty small in diameter. I'd much prefer larger diameter ear cups that were flatter to the head.

Major Con: This would have been a five star review except for the micro usb charging port.  As consumers we've got to tell tech company's these micro USB ports FAIL and we don't want them on our devices. I'm sick of having frequent-recharge devices such as cell phones and headphones turn into garbage when the ports wear out. And they always seem to wear out.  My headphones are shot because of the port failing. I'm just so sick of this design flaw. And it's everywhere. Boycott devices that use micro ports for recharging. But these are super headphones otherwise. *sigh*

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: I would buy these again, and again, and again....
column8: though i doubt ill ever need to buy another pair. very sturdy! Nearly perfect headphones! They are not as big as everyone makes them seem, they're about average size compared to other headphones with similar size drivers. Comfort, the ear-pads are heaven. thats about all you can say about them. some people complain about skullcandy not selling replacement pads, why do you need them? i've owned these for a year and 4 months not, and they have not once fallen off, nor have they ever torn. they look as good as day one the headband stretches as far as you need it to without breaking, however lacks any padding, after several hours of wearing them you start to feel they're on your head, but losen it up some and you'll be fine. Sound quality is unbeatable(like wise with skullcandy products-minus the jibs). music sounds great, and bass is better than any pair of beats. Tested beside a pair of beats solos, these were more comfortable, and very similar in sound quality but these still took the cake. the battery life is outrageous, i believe its advertised as 12 but i get more like 15 with volume turned up quite a bit. volume is plenty to tune out the background noise mowing the lawn. They're just stereo headphones, but they're more like an expensive gaming pair of headphones that you can REALLY tell the difference between left and right. no static noise ever. EVER. not even while messing with the backup cable, which is included(and has an inline mic), and i have used many a time with my ps4. the headset doesn't work with the bluetooth capabilities on the ps4 however because the ps4 doesn't support the profile for the headphones, however i use them while gaming on my pc with bluetooth just fine without sound latency. standard bluetooth range of around 30ft before they start to cut out. some people say they aren't loud enough, lies. they have an independent volume control on them so in order for them to be loud you have to turn up your phone, and the headphones. they have a matte plastic finish which doesn't look cheat at all, and doesn't show off your fingerprints like some glassy plastics do.

column8:
UPDATE: The battery life on these is incredible! I have used these many times for multiple hours, and the battery is still over 50%. I am amazed by the battery life! Aside from the issues below, I love these. I spend a lot of time with these headphones on doing homework. Due to the small size of the earpieces these start to hurt m ears a bit after several hours of wearing them. Despite these negatives, they are a very good value.

I was expecting better bass performance with these headphones, given the size of the drivers (50mm). The micro usb plug location on the headset for charging is in one of the worst locations, which makes it difficult to attach the cable without damaging the connector. Additionally, the ear pieces are a little small and barely fit over my ears, I wouldn't say that I have overly large ears, so if you do these might not be the best option for you.

Aside from these issues, these headphones are a dream. The leather ear pads are very soft, and comfortable. The sound quality is very clear. The volume controls are easy to identify, and operate. The styling of these is very nice and appealing.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: Low/Average sound quality over Bluetooth, doesn't work with PS3 game audio.
column8:
I was far less than impressed by these headphones.
Partially due to a few misunderstandings on my part, and partly due to the headphones themselves.

First off these will NOT play GAME audio on a Playstation 3 system, which was the primary reason I purchased them.
NO "normal" Bluetooth headphones will. These will ONLY work for in game chat, which is stupid, since by having both ears covered there is no way I could hear the game to play it.

Secondly, the ear-cups are much larger and looser than I anticipated, meaning that they were both insecure on my head, and at the same time pushed uncomfortably on my glasses.

Thirdly the quality of the sound over Bluetooth, from several devices was low average, lots of cutting out and weird clipping of sounds, also volume was far too low and they had a hard time staying paired with both my computer and my Galaxy S5 smart phone.

Positive notes:
Sound with the supplied 3.5 MM stereo cable attached was more acceptable, but kind of defeats the purpose of having wireless headphones.
They felt fairly sturdy, not like they were going to fall apart.

In the end I returned these as they were truly not what I'd bargained for.  With return shipping I lost about $5.50 on the deal.

The sort of stitch job you'd expect on a very low budget priced product.  Might be I got a lemon set, but frankly not impressed with the craftsmanship of the ear pads.  Everything else is top notch.  My only major complaint is the placement of the mini USB port.  Horribly inconvenient and difficult to plug the chord in.  The mic is also much lower quality than I expected. column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: Overall: Ok for music, great for video, great for the price for commuting.
column8: I don't know if this will be helpful to you, but I'm going to compare the Hesh 2 Wireless headphones to the other headphones I've had: theAudioMX Wireless Bluetooth 4.0 On-Ear Headphones Passive Noise Cancelling Headset with Built-In Microphone, 20-Hour Playing Time (at about the same price) and the Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer)(almost 5x more expensive headphones with wires.) Music Sound Quality: The Bose are awesome, great base and seperation of instruments, great sonic space. The AudioMax are surprisingly good -- great clarity and it actually makes you not miss the Bose. The Hesh 2 Wireless is a distant 3rd. The music feels flat and a bit compressed. It's OK but if you really like music, the AudioMax sound better. Video Sound Quality: Again, the Bose are amazing. However, the Hesh 2 are good for watching video on iOS and desktop. The AudioMax actually had a delay in sound, so the lipsync was always off (especially on iPhones and iPads.) The Hesh 2's handle it well and videos are totally watchable, lipsync is robust. Build Quality: For $60-ish headphones, the build quality is quite solid. It's all plastic, but good quality plastic. I feel confident taking them on the subway and train. Overall: Ok for music, great for video, great for the price for commuting.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8:
They are very comfortable over/on ear headphones. Sound is decent across most genres but they aren't especially bass-centric.  They also cancel a good amount of exterior noise. They paired easily and had no static or breaking up of sound when my phone/ipod is in my pocket or with movement like some other bluetooth headphones do.

My only dislike is the size...they stick out from the side of my head a lot. It seems like an almost unnecessary amount given the technology we have today. I guess it gives them a semi-retro look, but still, they almosy look goofy.

I will definitely be keeping these, and for the price they are great. Fortunately I only use headphones for the gym and I don't usually make  movements that would interfere with these sticking off the sides of my head.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8: I absolutely love these headphones! They are very comfortable and soft. The sound is great and they can be paired with two devices. A little pricey but worth the money.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8:
I absolutely love these headphones. I've tried a lot of different wireless headphones and these are the only ones that worked. I'm a transcriptionist so I use headphones A LOT. Good sound quality is absolutely essential for me, and these definitely give me that. Comfort is also a concern and these are some of the most comfortable I have ever worn. Battery life is great. I usually charge them about once a week, and they're good for several a few hours a day.

If I had to name a disadvantage, the USB port for the charger is really awkward to get to. Certainly wasn't a dealbreaker for me and shouldn't be for you. Other features more than make up for that tiny issue.

Wanted to add a note that I've used these for two years now. The only issue is that I have to tape the charger down to get a charge. But these things are so awesome I'd rather deal with that inconvenience than buy anything else.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8:
Do not trust my star rating just yet. I literally just opened them up, paired them, and started a single song. That first song isn't even finished playing yet and I'm typing this review.

These are just my first impressions.

These are NOT over-the-ear headphones. Just to be clear. They are circular, and fairly large openings, but they do NOT fit over my ears completely. I'm not sure if I like this or not yet. The "ear cushions" are indeed soft and pillowy. I can't imagine them hurting over long periods of time like some other headphones, but I'll try to come back and update this review when I've used them for a few days.

The tops of my ears fit snuggly inside the openings, but I can still feel the cushions pressing slightly on them. I may be able to adjust them to make that not the case, but the lower part of my ears are definitely not inside the openings, and it feels awkward to not have my ears completely enclosed.

The sound is SLIGHTLY muffled/muted. Lower volumes so far seem slightly muffled, but louder volumes don't seem to be as bad. Granted, I didn't get these to listen to them on low volume. I got them because I want to be able to crank my music up without bothering people in adjacent offices without being tethered by a cord.

They are heavy. From what I can see they would not be good for jogging or biking. But what do I know, I haven't biked or jogged in years.

I'm now on the fourth song, and I'm liking them. Again, slightly muffled, but not bad for bluetooth and $60. It's going to take some getting used to with my ears not quite fitting, but if they don't give me ear fatigue, I think I can deal with that.

I don't think I'll return them, but if I were to purchase fresh right now, knowing what I know, I might look for headphones where my ears fit fully inside. True over-the-ear headphones.

-----

11 songs in: I've forgotten about the awkwardness of my ears, but instead my ears have felt... I don't know how to put it... suffocated? Like, I need to take them off to let my ears breathe a little bit. I haven't, but I feel like they need to a tad. It's a little warm. I might get used to this as well.

-----

5.5 hours of solid listening later, I'm getting a little bit of ear fatigue in my lower right ear, as well as the backs of both ears. It's not as extreme as the last pair of headphones I had been using that were on the ear, but it's still not as long term wearing as I was hoping for.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: Alot more awesome then I was expecting
column8:
These have a VERY good sound. Not real heavy on the bass as the Sony set I had bought. And does not have any "tingy" sound to them as other cheaper sets. I am not an audiophile by any means but I rate these very highly. They have an evenly balanced sound.
The Skull Candy has a nice sound while on Bluetooth although they do not get extremely loud, but loud enough to enjoy your music. Plug in the 3.5mm cable and watch out, they can get EXTREMLY loud. I love the wireless option, so I can put up with a little less sound. The controls are easy to adjust while on wireless and it was easy to pair up on Bluetooth. I have had Skull Candy earbuds and they were nice too, except they never seemed to last long. I am hopeful these will be around for years to come.

The only 2 cons I can see at this point. 1. I would have liked them to be able to get louder on Bluetooth. 2. They say over the ear, but they are not quite that big. They are in between over the ear and on the ear. If you have small or medium ears, I think you should be ok, but if you have large ears, forget it. Mine almost cover my ears, it touches the top and bottom of my ears. I should be able to handle this, but I really prefer the true over the ear headphones. But I like these enough I will keep them and use them. If you wear earrings, they may push the studs a little, I could see that getting uncomfortable for an extended period.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: Total Fail!!!  Stay Away if you like Good Sound and Comfort!
column8:
When I purchase a set of headphones, I am looking for comfort and quality sound.  These headphones fail miserably in both categories.

When I first opened the box and pulled these out out I was impressed, they look really cool and feel durable.  I charged them and when I heard the first song I played I was totally let down.  They sounded as if they were playing behind pillows; very muffled and very drab sounding.  The highs were not clear, the mids were non-existent and the bass plain sucked.

I thought how lame!  Skullcandy is supposed to be a good name in headphones.  Anyway I tried listening to these thinking maybe I could get used to them.  However after about 3 songs, my ears began to hurt because the padding inside was pressing too hard against my ears.  In baseball hats, I wear a size 8 so my head is not big in any way.  These were just plain uncomfortable for anything over 15 minutes or so.

The final straw was when they started cutting out intermittently far too often then they should.

For $70 dollars, these are a total waste of money.  They may look nice, but when you cannot wear them for extended periods of time and the sound is so bad, you don't want to listen to them, they are useless.  The 1 star goes to Amazon for accepting the return of these horrendous headphones.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: The Blue Flashing LED is ANNOYING! otherwise, pretty great!
column8:
I've only had these things for about a week, but initial impressions are good.

Pros:
- The sound is nice and crisp, The bass is not overpowering, and with an equilizer, you can really customize the sound.
- The headband is soft and the ear cups are comfortable.
- They're very easy to use; intuitive.
- The included stereo cable, used to run them when the battery is dead, is short, but works great.
- They've fixed the charging port location. A lot of these reviews say that the charging port is on the top of the ear cup, It's now on the bottom next to the stereo cable jack, so you can wear and charge at the same time.

Cons: (You knew there had to be a few since it's not a 5 star review)
- The ear cups have very little give, so they don't twist to fit the angle of your ears at all. can get a little uncomfortable after a couple hours of use.
- The headband appears to be plastic. I've had 3 other pairs of SkullCandy headphones (Skull Crushers and 2 other pairs of Hesh) with similar headbands, and they've all broken in the past. I bought an extended warranty on these so that when (not if) the ear cup breaks off, I can get it replaced
- (The BIGGEST con so far!!!) The power button is surrounded by lighted LED ring that flashes blue while connected. While this isn't a problem for me (I can't see it when listening to them), it's very distracting to others when you're listening in a dark room or on the bus before the sun comes up. it would be VERY nice if the flashing could be turned off, My wife used them for a while and I kept seeing the flash out of the corner of my eye, and it was really disruptive and annoying. I get it that there needs to be an indicator that it's still connected, but put it somewhere where it doesn't annoy the heck out of other people. I'm now very self conscience about using these on the bus, because I don't want to annoy my fellow commuters.

That's really it, They're pretty great, but not quite 5 star great.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8:
I work remotely, so I spend a lot of time in front of my computer in a noisy home. A good pair of noise-cancelling headphones with a built-in mic for my many conference calls seemed ideal!
Not so much.
As a caveat, I am not an audiophile, and I don't have boatloads of money to spend on audio and computer equipment. This was the most money I've ever spent on a pair of headphones.

The noise cancelling was great, surrounding sound was blocked out completely. And these are quite comfortable, I had no trouble wearing them several hours at a time. The Bluetooth connection was strong and never wavered.

Everything else? Pretty bad. The sound was muffled, like it was trying to saturate the bass too hard, which made everything sort of fuzzy. The mic is complete garbage - I was repeatedly told that my coworkers couldn't hear anything I was saying, despite speaking quite loudly. In other words, the two things I needed this headset to do - play sound and record - it did poorly.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black

They have a great amount of bass and mid/highs. Again not too loud, and they fit comfortably around my ears. I wouldn't say they are totally noise cancelling but they definitely keep out a great deal of noise. I certainly recommend these head phones, and the price is very nice.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: Not Completely Over the Ear, but Still Great Headphones
column8:
Let's start with what everyone is most concerned with regarding over-the-ear headphones.  Do these headphones go over your entire ear?  Sadly, this is not the case.  If you are insistent on having Skullcandy headphones that cover your entire ear, then your best bet are the Crushers which, as of the typing of this review, are not wireless.

That little issue aside, let's talk about the product.  These headphones are very comfortable to wear and mostly go over your ear.  With the way I wear them, they touch the top of my ear.  Skullcandy claims Hesh 2 headphones have a fifteen hour charge.  I've used these listening to music off and on for a total of eight hours thus far with no issues so I can't say for sure if the fifteen hour claim is accurate.  Music comes through well enough for me.  I'm not an audio snob so if the bass is a little off or the treble is a wee bit high means nothing to me.  I can hear my music and it sounds rich and clear.  They aren't noise cancelling so you can hear some sounds around you.  They are also not consider noise cancelling so if you find that to be a problem, then get noise cancelling headphones.  As for using the headphones for phone calls, they work well enough. Callers can hear my voice clearly and I can hear them well. There is an annoying delay that comes with Bluetooth usage so I opt not to use them for phone calls.

Overall, I love them.  Yet another wonderful product from Skullcandy.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8:
Okay, first off, since a lot of people mention Beats, let me just mention, Beats are about $5 headphones with extra weight added because that makes them feel more expensive. People buy them because of the cache and the celebrity endorsements. Beats are garbage, and spending money on them is a huge waste. Yes, these are better than Beats, a lot of headphones are.

Pros:
Super comfortable
Very durable
Onboard controls
Long battery life
Cute design: I like the little skulls on the band

Cons:
Heavy
Very Quiet, even at full blast, I find it insufficient.
No noise cancelation, makes the volume issue worse.
Comes in a giant stupid bag, and doesn't fold, so storing them is a huge pain in the ass.
I've been told on calls that it sounds echoey and the caller can hear themselves on the other end. This has only happened a couple times, and usually when I'm laying down.

So all in all, these seem ideal for gamers who want to sit in a quiet room and have a headset to play games and chat. But for commuters and people who may be going through noisy areas and might want noise cancelation, not so much. They are super comfortable though, I will say that even a second time. They are SUUUUUPER comfortable, haha. And I like the little LED flashes, the colors, the sounds, the style of the headphone is very nice. It's very cute, is very well

After a lot of shopping around, I've settled on a less known brand. Finding the perfect headphones can be a journey, but it's well worth it when you have the ones you need. ;)

The bluetooth also has really good range, as they still work even when he's in different rooms or floors of the house. He compared them to my nephew's beats solo headphones, and said that while the beats get louder, the sound quality of the skullcandy headphones seems to be better. Considering the price point, I would say these are definitely worth the money, although admittedly I got them on sale during black Friday for $54.

Although they are rather large, they aren't really heavy and the ear pieces are pillow soft. They are so comfortable to wear, even after having them on for over an hour. The battery charge lasts quite a while so running low hasn't been a problem for him. The volume control is easy to use with raised symbols on the head piece. The wireless feature makes it so nice as there are no cords to get tangled when he walks around while talking. I would recommend these to anyone who is interested in a headset that has a clear sound quality to their phone conversations.

Cons:

-Not crazy loud... (Which is fine I use these at work)
-Fatigued the top of my ears in under 15 mins...

Overall for under 70 dollars these seem ok, the fit is my only complaint.  Will update as time goes on.

Update 12/21/2015
Returned item for a different brand ear fatigue was way too bad.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8: My oldest son bought a pair of these at Sam's Club with his birthday money back in September. Last week the female headphone jack receptacle broke inside the headset. This is when we also found out the Bluetooth was no longer functioning. They lasted just a little less than three months. That is utterly ridiculous. We were pleased with these until they stopped working. Unfortunately I bought a pair for my younger son for Xmas and I am worried about how long they will last.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8:
Sound quality is excellent.  Just the right amount of Bass. Battery life is phenomenal.  After it was delivered, I didn't even charge it, and listened to it for hours.

Pairing is very easy, and the controls on the headphones are very well placed and large enough to tell what is what just by feel.  The mic works good too talking on the phone.

My sister in law used them, now she wants a pair.

I also have a large head, but I can wear them for a longtime and it isn't uncomfortable.  Incredible bargain if you can get them on sale like I did.  They are still a great buy even if they aren't on sale.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8: Fantastic headphones!

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: Bluetooth stutter and distorts the sound.  BT and wired produce poor sound quality.
column8:
I tried the wired version in a store.  Evidently, the display had highly processed music because every range came through in a pleasing manner.  When I received these, I tried them.  The Hesh2 paired very easily with my iPad.  After that, it was very less than adequate.  I used a very familiar albumI have been listening to this album, in different formats, for 30 years.  The sound quality was poor, not all ranges were presented accurately and hear-able.  It is a problem to be missing parts of songs and know they should be "there"  The poor quality sound was on bluethooth and wired connections.
On bluetooth, the music would stutter at times.  It would pick up at the same place as before the stutter.  There were occasions when the music would "warble"slow down and pick up with some pitch distortion.  The Hesh2 were always within 2 feet of my iPad.

My previous wired headphones have none of these problems: Koss DJ/100& 200.  Being wired, they require a cable.
I returned the Hesh2 and will either try the Koss bluetooth headphones or the Bose over the ear, bluetooth headphones.

Good things: the bluetooth paired very easily; the headphones are comfortable and can be worn for hours.
Amazon's return policy is very good and I was able to get an return authorization quickly and shipped the Hesh2 back as a return the same day.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8: Balanced sound, doesn't get as loud as most others amped headphones like beats, but sound is cleaner

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: Good sound quality, not great comfort
column8: I ordered these based on the reviews of others and while I agree that the sound quality is pretty good for bluetooth headphones, the problem for me was comfort. The earcups are too small to fit my ears *inside* and thus, they are more like on-ear headphones for me. After about 30 minutes of wearing these, my ears start to hurt and because the ear cups are not interchangeable, I can't even get larger ones. Ultimately, I think I'm going to return these for the Photive BTH3 Over-The-Ear Wireless Bluetooth Headphones with Built-in Mic and 12 Hour Battery. Includes Hard Travel Case.. The ear cups are soft, which is definitely nice, just not soft enough for my taste. Sound quality: 7/10 Comfort: 5/10 Build quality: 8/10

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8: I bought these to use with my new Apple Tv 4 and they work great.  Pairing was a cinch and when you power them on they automatically connect. Charging is fast and the battery life is as advertised.  These are very well made and do not feel cheap.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8: Purchased these at Wal-Mart and I love them so much that I just have to write a review. The low tones are balanced with the high tones. I've had problems with other headphones being too bass heavy and muddling out the rest of the music. These are perfect, with a nice long battery life and a cord to use in case the headphones run out of battery power. These come with a fabric bag to carry them in, but I plan on purchasing a hardshell case to protect them. All in all, good quality, simple design. Love them!

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: NOT nearly Bose SoundLink On-Ear Bluetooth Wireless Headphones (Best rated BT Headphones at ANY $$), but very good nevertheless.
column8:
Very nice for the price. Clear, crisp sound especially connected to my Bluetooth headphone amp with 0 distortion even at max. volume. Heavy Bass. Just ok without the extra 60 watts from the amp. The Bose, without or without the amp, blow these off the charts. Got the Bose "Like New, open box" here on amazon for 149.00

Got these in a "Lightning sale" here on amazon for 54.99.  wall mart (sic) reg. price for these 59.94. I purchased soft velour ON EAR covers for these because the PLEATHER made my ears sweat within 5 minutes. These are 3 1/2 inches so if you get covers get 4 inches, as they slip right over these & if necessary Electrical tape matches all ear covers securing edges anyway, so you can secure them easily with that & no one will ever notice. 3 1/2 did not fit over the pleather, & removing the pleather then putting the covers on didn't work right. Doesn't affect the volume or sound at all.

Frankly, unless you're hitting these with some real power, they are too low in volume for the 50mm Drivers. Plug em in any home theater Receiver & you'll see what I mean-bzzz to THUMP! Even so, the Bose are tiny compared to these but have much fuller sound, handle high power effortlessly, better Bass & if you find a good "Used" pair backed by amazon then spend a little more, for A LOT MORE. Crazy tiny MINDBLOWERS those little Bose!

Also, takes a good 5 seconds to power on while holding the stiff power button. Same with turning off. No padding for your head (I made one off older headphones-velcro'd right on) & they are huge for Bluetooth. They do not fold & come with a cloth "Case".

You get what you pay for, but these are worth no more than 150.00 (Retail) & that's it. Rated #2 of all Bluetooth headphones, price being the MAIN consideration.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8: Great headset while it lasts. Battery become useless after 6 months. Wouldn't recommend.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8: The shipping was fast, and I was able to pair it with the Bluetooth on my phone in seconds. The sound quality is good. I had a pair of Beats that had more bass. For the price, this was perfect for me. I am able to listen while at the gym and I love them.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: Incredible Headphones for an Incredible Price
column8: I actually got these at Walmart on black Friday, but I have to say that this is easily one of the top 3 pairs of headphones or earbuds that I have ever had the pleasure of using. When I am not listening to Pandora on my phone through the bluetooth, I am editing video on my computer or listening to podcasts with these headphones. Look non further. As far as a budget pair of headphones goes, these take the cake. That is all coming from someone with a pair of professional Audio Technica studio headphones.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8:
This is going to be a critical 2-star review.
I received them as a gift and was really trying not to be critical but I couldn't but share my thoughts.

Pros:
- good battery life, I easily get 3-4 days with moderate usage between charging
- decent build quality excluding the quality of the actual phones
- relatively light

Cons:
- bad to mediocre sound quality for headphones this large. This is really disappointing, especially considering that other companies have models that remain virtually unchanged for 25+ years and have superior sound quality. Take Sony MDR-V6, for example. The sound of Hesh 2 is far removed, lacks details as if you're listening to the music in through the wall or have a bag on your head. Bass is a bit loud which probably makes trending music sound a bit "better" or rather not as bad.
- blinking LED light around power button that you can't turn off, at night it becomes very annoying as it's quite bright and reminds me of nothing but of an aircraft with a strobe light on.
- not the best design, a bit bulky - but that is probably a limitation of modern technology when you need to cramp a receiver and a Li-Ion battery into headphones

Verdict:
Mediocre sound quality makes these headphones a bad choice for majority of people. However, if you don't care much about sound quality and want  long-lasting headphones they are not that bad.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black

column8: Love these, i wear them at the gym, great base and clarity even at high volumes, the sweat doesn't seem to affect them at all either. Good range on the Bluetooth and they look great. I would purchase them again and i'm very picky about headphones.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8:
great headphones, intuitive controls, seem to be decent quality.
They do make my ears heat up - would be great for cold weather, but sitting at my desk for hours on end I couldn't stand having these on. That said, my ears have always been over sensitive.

I used them for a few days before returning them.
Pairing was simple. On my iPhone 6 it showed a battery indicator on the bluetooth bar, which was nice.
They had great sound and decent battery life.
They come with a cord so you can use them on a flight with out flight attendants getting uppity about using bluetooth. Its nice to not have to carry an extra set of headphones, and you don't have to fight a cable when walking around the airport.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8:
This is going to be my review of the skull candy hesh2 wireless Bluetooth
let's start off with just the box the box is informative and minimalistic but classy the instructions are clearly visible the features are clearly visible some of them aren't exactly accurate to my standard but to the layman they will give you a good understanding of exactly what you're getting
once you open the package they come out looking great you get the headset the cable and instruction booklet and most of the things that you find in a new set of headphones so let's get on to just the headphones their beautiful there very sturdy no clicking in rattling sounds when you shake them they look very quality orientated the skull candy logo is across the top and there is a logo on the right and left sides and the cups are strangely comfortable if you followed my instructions you know that they come with 50 mm speakers it built in microphone and the cable includes a microphone also at first glance I would call it a noise canceling microphone but the instructions say that it can be used as a microphone unto itself there is the large volume buttons a pairing button which also doubles as a power button now I would say that is the biggest points of its physical appearance now once I connected the headphones by cable to my PC it was apparent that the sound quality was great not very busy it has that high fidelity yield to it the microphone worked very well with the cable but like I said on my first impression of these headphones I really believe that the sound was being conveyed to the system from the headphones themselves and the instructions say that it can happen that way but the real reason why I'm getting very clear sound from my voice into the system is that included headphone microphone that is connected to the cable not from the microphone coming from the headphones themselves and again I believed that these were wireless headphones but you've got to remember like I said there's a cable and that is how the sound is being conveyed to the headphones I did get a chance to use them in their wireless capacity that quality of sound is considerably less than the cable connection considerably what I have found out in the last week while not yet a week but in the time that I've had them
at first I really considered returning them because I was not satisfied with the connectivity portion of the headphones but having them now for a week I have reconsidered my conclusion about the connectivity usually I use my headphones at my computer so being connected that way for high fidelity sound is not a bad thing and when I use the headphones with my cell phone it gives me in option I can just plug the included table into my cell phone or go it wirelessly via Bluetooth I can also receive sound from my computer via Bluetooth and also use the microphone via Bluetooth the only thing I have a problem is that in the Bluetooth connectivity side of the equation the quality is greatly decrease I don't even believe that the sound quality coming via Bluetooth is stereo the booklet and the box says that it is but when you listen to the sound you'll be able to tell that it's not really that way the first time you use the cable you will understand what I'm saying but even for a wired set of headphones to give you the fidelity and the response that you get from these you're going to be happy with the results I have used many different types of headphones wired and wirelessly turtle Beach Corsair Logitech and so on they all start off with great construction except for the turtle Beach in my price range they were not constructed very well as well is to a be expected for the price point but they never lasted past one year but like I said for the price it kind of balance itself out but when you spend more than $100 for a pair of headphones you really need to be a little bit more careful only because I don't know how your budget is but I can't afford to buy a new set of headphones every few months they have to last me at least a year to be viable at a certain price point as far as longevity goes I had my Corsair headphones for more than a year closer to two my Logitech's lasted exactly one year turtle Beach I still have two or three of them still working not wirelessly but they are still working and I usually give those headphones to my kids or someone in need at the time and I can always fall back to my wired headphones whenever you're having battery problems we know how that goes but with these headphones if the batteries should go down the wired connection still work with or without battery life which meant that I could keep these headphones in use longer than any of the others so as far as quality and performance I would say that these are pretty good for someone looking to do a little like gaming sometimes just spending time on your cell phone talking to your friends or just listening to music I would say there a good addition to someone who's got maybe two or three other sets of headphones for different applications because you can use these with your cell phone or any other Bluetooth connection that should be available television VCR anything that you have that is Bluetooth connected and the battery life is pretty good it says 15 hours of continuous use but you usually don't sit down for 15 hours so you figure if you sitting in front of the computer to her three hours at a time in a day you've got to three days of battery time there and if you just use a number use your phone it's even more and like I said if you have the wire with you you can use it until the batteries go dead and then just plug the wire in until you get home to charge them up I haven't had that problem yet I hope I won't have that problem but in the case that it might happen I know that I won't be without until etc.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: Do not buy if you have large ears
column8:
These are moderately priced over-the-ear Bluetooth headphones. I intended to use them for watching TV with my Dish Network hopper when I do not wish to disturb my wife with the sound. They work well for that.

The good: They have good sound, paired easily, and seem to have good battery life. They seemed comfortable at first on my ears.
The not so good: I have moderately large ears. After using the headphones for half an hour the outside part of my ears began to hurt - I believe from having been folded into the earpiece. The headphones also began to feel tight on my head and I don't see a way to loosen the pressure on the sides of my head.

Conclusion: They are OK for short periods of listening, but not so good for longer periods - especially if you have large ears or a large head. That's really a shame because the price and audio performance are quite good. I'm sorry I bought them in my particular case.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: When wired the volume is certainly better, id still like to squeeze more volume out
column8:
Had these for a about 2 weeks.  Enjoying these headphones so far, the wirelessness is a God send.
My two complaints are limited volume in bluetooth mode, and sound leakage.

When using them wirelessly i have to punch the music or movie up to full volume.  When wired the volume is certainly better, id still like to squeeze more volume out.

As for sound leakage, I was very surprised to find that when on my head if some is close enough you can hear what im listening to.  Depending on the content thats not always desirable.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: One annoying flaw - recharge port position.
column8: Sound is good, the buttons are easy to find and use, the ear pads could be cushier, but they're not uncomfortable. There's one big design flaw. The port to recharge the headphones is in an incredibly difficult place to access. It's not as hard as removing the funny bone in the game Operation, but it's not easy either. The USB charging port is on top of the left can but it's covered by the headband. So, to recharge it you have to pivot the left can out and hold the headphones so the port is exposed with one hand and then jack in with the other into a tight space. The port should be on the bottom of the can where the headband doesn't interfere.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: Quality headphones, but not ideal for big head/big ears
column8:
The sound quality on these headphones is very solid. I also like the large volume control buttons and the aux cable option. But I have had a few minor issues:

1. The clamp pressure is a little bit on the tight side. This is what allows for the noise isolation. I suppose it wouldn't be an issue for a small headed person, but I have a decent sized head, so it is a little snug for my liking. Also, it can get warm fast if you are using for exercise.

2. The cups are a little small for my larger than average ears, so I have to bend them ever so slightly to fit into the cups. This is not a huge issue for short term listening, but after a while can certainly get annoying.

3. I have had issues with connectivity to my laptop. I use these on both my smart phone and laptop. No issues with smart phone, but lately (after a month) I have had issues connecting to my laptop. Most of my other headphones (I have about 6 other pairs) have no problem connecting so I know the issue is not with the computer. I will update if I find out anything new.

Overall, I would recommend this product- especially if you don't have a large head/large ears. If you do, then I'd recommend getting a pair with a larger cup size and less clamp pressure. Best of luck! =)

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: Buy if m sound and comfort doesn't matter a lot
column8: I've still have the Hesh 1.0 which is still uncomfortable. Thought of trying the new Hesh 2.0 but it's the same thing. The headphone is a great substitute over the other expensive brands with a good battery life but I didn't find it comfortable and it didn't deliver much bass even after changing the equalizer in the phone. The price is good, looks, finish and everything else except the sound and comfort. I used it for 7 days but after just wearing about 15-20 minutes straight, the outer ear starts to hurt. I'll suggest searching more on Amazon and buying V-Moda which is a bit expensive but the sound and comfort is pretty good over the Hesh 2.0.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8:
I didn't buy these from amazon, I got mine from best buy. And I am leaving my honest review and received NOT A THING for it. So....

As far as sound..... They are actually pretty decent. If you like a full sound with good highs and good base then these are decent. But it could be louder in my opinion. I like my music super cranked and as far as Mobile devices, it doesn't get THAT loud. Maybe on a laptop it will. But overall, its a really decent sounding pair of earphones.

Bluetooth or wire in, the sound is pretty much the same. I say that because I've read reviews that said the Bluetooth sound is lower than the wire in sound. If you buy new ones, thats NOT true.

I also read reviews said said they are heavy and uncomfortable. That will probably depend on your head size. But they are not heavy at all. They don't hurt. Very comfortable. But that's me.

Very easy to connect and battery life is pretty extensive.

And like the guy told me when I bought em, these aren't for exercising or working out in. They are for when your chilling. If you need something for on the go, get the smoking buds 2 wireless. I haven't tried them so I can't tell you what they are like.

I'm listening to yo gotti on these now and I like it lol. As far as noise cancelling, unless you have them turned up, doesn't cancel too much noise. So.. Don't buy these for that.

Overall I recommend these if you want something wireless and "good enough" for the time being until you can get something like Bose. That exactly what I'm going to do. But very nice headphones though. And that is real.

Oh yea, the charge port is in a weird place behind the left ear pad. Be gentle when plugging in.

Update..10/30/15.. I finally used these to talk on the phone and the mic picks up great. I could hear the other party clearly and they could hear me clearly.

column8:
This review is updated after one month of use.

I would say this is an awesome headphone for its price. I got this pair for somewhere around $60 when there is a discount. Regarding this price, the performance is outstanding among its peers.

Pros:

1. Design is simple, function is easily accessible.
2. The volume is neither too loud nor too small. I would say it's very well adjusted. I once had a Jabra Move, but the sound is way too loud. Even the lowest level on that headphone hurts my ears after half an hour. The loudest sound on this pair is very loud. I would never use this loud volume anyway. I am good with around level 3 volume on a noisy bus.
3. Noise isolation is enough, on buses and subways. It cannot block everything, but the noise isolation make the music much better on these noisy environment. In an office environment, it will block others' conversation with music on volume level 2.
4. The sound quality is good in terms of Bluetooth streamed music. Off course it can not offer the same quality as those wired headphones, but the sound is good enough for you to immerse in the music instead of complaining a messed and muffed sound. (Note: I have never test it using corded option. I don't think there is any point to use a bluetooth headphone with cords.)
5. Battery life is awesome. I charge once a week.

Cons:

1. The headphone is kind of hot, it suffocated my ear in one hour of use. It would be better in winter or in AC cooled room in summer. But it is definitely not a wise choice to ware it outside in summer.
2. Can only connect to one device at a time. For some other models, you can get two connections at once and switch between them easily. This model cannot do that.
3. The charging port is at a wired position, making it almost impossible to listen to the music and charge at the same time. Well, I won't do it anyway. And I won't seriously consider this as a downside because it hides the charging port cleverly when you are using it.

Some other things to say about comfortableness:

As some comments point out, the pad is some kind of small. Some users complain that it's uncomfortable because it can only act as an on-ear headphone. The trick is, you have to put your whole upper back position of your ear INTO the pad. It is OK if the lower and front side of your ear get pushed by the pad a little bit if you get a big ear. DO NOT wear it like an on-ear headphone, it is not designed that way. I wear this headphone comfortably for one hour even I have a pair of glasses under the pad. With the Jabra Move I once had, it really gives me a headache after 20 mins of use.

HOWEVER, this pair will not last long on my head. After approximately two hours, I became notice of the uncomfortable felling and have to take it off for 15 mins for a break.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: HUGE Volume Deficiency when connected via Bluetooth
column8:
I bought these from Best Buy. I love bass and loud music. These headphones sound great when they are wired, but when on Bluetooth there is a substantial volume deficiency.

I read other reviews about this before purchasing and gave them a try anyway. That was a mistake.

I exchanged these at best buy for Sony's MDR-XB950BT which were on sale for $150 and they completely blow away these Hesh 2's. For an extra $50 I am completely satisfied. The extra bass feature really cranks up the bass. They sell the Sony's on Amazon for $148 at the moment.

If you can afford the extra $50, go with the Sony's. If you can't afford it or if you don't care to have your music loud, the Hesh 2 is an okay alternative. The volume deficiency while connected via Bluetooth was a deal killer for me. There is no deficiency in volume with the Sony's.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: Great sound, range, and a good build.
column8:
Surprisingly good... I own a pair of Parrot Ziks, Wireless Beats, etc. - I got these because I wanted something I could take to work with me and I am seriously beside myself. The sound is not super bass heavy like it's competitors, but it is clean and you can hear a wide range. That said, I tested the bass against my "go-to" ( On My Level - Wiz Khalifa, feat. Too $hort ) and they sound great.

Pros:
- Great sound. Can compete with higher priced headphones easily. Right now they're scoring above my Ziks.
- Big ol' buttons... The buttons are huge on the headset. That means you're not fumbling for some tiny thing and accidentally go to the next song, and if you've done that while listening to Pandora you know how infuriating that can be.
- Range is amazing. I left my phone downstairs and was microwaving a pizza when I realized I've been walking around my house with these things still going strong. I can even walk around my garage with the phone in the basement and they're still crisp.
- Comfortable, but secure. You can do things around the house and they won't fall off your head.

Cons:
- I have kind of a giant head and they're a bit tight, this will likely change with repeated use so I'm not super worried. I actually wear them backward ( L on right ear, R on left ear ) as that is more comfy.

Definitely recommended.... if that changes I'll update the review. - on that note, I just bought a second pair. The ones on my head at the moment came from Best Buy.

Songs used for testing:
> On My Level - Wiz Khalifa, feat. Too $hort
> The Message - Nas ( meh.. they did ok with this one )
> California Love - Tupac
> Hypnotize - Notorious B.I.G.
> Fallen - Volbeat
> Engel - Rammstein
> Lie To Me - Red
> Polyamorous - Breaking Benjamin
> Human After All - Daft Punk ( performed very well w. this one )
> This Is What It Feels Like - Armin van Buuren
> Crash and Burn - Thomas Rhett ( you're welcome.. I hate country. )

I tried to put these things through their paces. So far so good.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Wireless really impressed me!
column8:
I love these headphones. Some ppl mention that they are a little heavy, I would add that they are a little wide as well from right to left compared to more streamlined models from Bose and Sony. They are wireless though! They actually sound really good on bluetooth and they have a cable just in case your power runs out. Those points themselves are great but I can also add that the battery lasts forever ... so far, I've charged them every week or so just in case I was running low.

I can add that also, even though they are a few ounces heavier than others, for me, they never really feel uncomfortable and I was able to get them for 80 dollars at Bestbuy matching the Amazon Prime price. For a comparable Bluetooth headphone at this price range, it doesn't really exist. Even the Sony ones I mentioned are around 100 dollars but the quality from what I've read isn't as good.

I totally recommend these if only for convenience. If you go wireless, you won't want to go back.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: Uncomfortable, Mediocre sound, passable Bluetooth performance.
column8:
First things first, these are horribly uncomfortable. The cups are WAY too small. I didn't think I had big ears but these are starting to make me feel self conscious. They are described to go around the ear but unless I fold my ears into them, they sit on the ear. The clamping force is also way too high. These things will give me a massive headache after a short while. They also don't breathe. Man do they get hot.

Second, the sound. While not terrible, they are FAR from great. They are very bass heavy and it's not clean bass either. Basically they just sound all around kinda muddy. I can get them sounding acceptable on my phone with a lot of EQ tweaking though but all my other headphones just sound better.

And now for the main reason I originally bought them. The Bluetooth functionality is the best part. It connected to my old phone quick (Droid Razr M). The controls worked great. HOWEVER, the signal was not the best. With the phone in my pocket, audio would often stutter. It was kinda random though. It's not as bad on my new phone (OnePlus One) but still happens. It might have something to do with the fact that I think the Bluetooth module is in the right side of the headphones and I keep my phone in my left pocket. Still, if that's the case, I would still expect better performance. If my phone can pair with a 2014 Subaru Forester 30 feet away, then it should be able to work with these headphones 3 feet away.

I originally bought these because the headphone jack on my old Droid Razr M broke. They served their purpose and are officially retired. Since the headphone jack works perfectly fine on my OnePlus One, I'm back to my Sennheiser PX 360's. One positive though. I recently bought some Philips SHP9500 headphones for my PC (which sound great and are supremely comfortable, just no bluetooth and are an open design) and the cord was too long. The back up cord that comes with the Heshes was a perfect replacement. Geez. Most expensive Aux cable I've ever bought.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column7: This SkullCandy Hesh 2.0 is NOT GOOD.  Don't believe the good reviews here.
column8:
Have no idea why the reviews here are more than two stars.  This Hesh 2 is not worth the $100.  There are two good things about this headset:

1.  They don't fall off easily like the Sennheiser wireless headphones.
2.  The battery charge life is long

BUT, these two things are not offset by the defects in design:

1.  The sound is muffled, poor, and lacks brilliance.
2.  The buttons for on/off, higher volume, and lower volume and not palpable.  To locate and use them one has to remove the headset to find the + and - buttons, unless one is skilled in braille.
3.  My set was NOT stereo.
4.  They apply a bit too much pressure on the head, but that's improved if one reverses right and left.
5.  No treble/bass adjustment (the company alleges that this feature will be added in the near future)
6.  The signal travels about only 20 feet max.  My other pair is wireless, not bluetooth, and they transmit at least 100 feet.

Returning this set to the retailer.

column7: A Very Happy Teenager going Wireless....Buy these headphones!!
column8:
If you are shopping for wireless headphones and do not want to break the bank with paying outrageous mark-ups for famous Rap artist brand names (I think you know who we are referring to) this is the set for you! We paid around $100 for these new (12/2014). Please be watchful of pricing as they are all over the place. These headphones hold their charge, are very high quality and are easy to connect via Bluetooth. I heard great things about Skullcandy and they did not disappoint!

5-30-15. Houston we (had) a problem....The headphones stopped working. Not certain what the issue was but no worries, They're Skullcandy and 100% covered under warranty! I contacted Tech Support and they swiftly moved to get us a shipping label. I was told by the rep to use UPS ground to save cost. Once my defective pair was received Skullcandy promptly sent me an online coupon code good for a free pair---no hassles, no interrogations, no excuses, just new pair with no questions asked!! We had the problem resolved in under 2 weeks....AMAZING!! I'll give 5 stars to the Skullcandy company for stellar service, too. Another great reason to BUY SKULLCANDY!!

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8:
Good headphones.
I would recommend these overall. Good performance, mid-range price.

Pros:
Good balance of sound. Good at noise isolation. Bluetooth works great. Charge lasts a long time.

Cons:
Heavy. Ear cups start to get painful after about 30-45 minutes of use. Charging port is in an awkward position.

The pros outweigh the cons with these. I'm glad I purchased them, but would have liked to have tried out something like the Jabra Move/Revo first. The packaging on these is such that it basically gets destroyed when you open them, making returning pretty much impossible.

The sound has a good balance of treble/mid/bass, not too heavy or lacking in any of them. If I had to make one modification, I'd increase the bass level just a touch for a little more oomph. Otherwise they work great with anything I've tried: electronic, metal, rock, acoustic...

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8:
This chick LOVES these! I work in Electronics. I've heard many-a headphones. These are one of the best as far as sound quality, bass and freedom I've heard within the price range (up to 199.99). Beating out even Beats by Dre, especially in quality for price. I first thought that they weren't that great, as I used them with my phone, playing Pandora. I felt like they didn't get loud enough for me (I'm amazed I'm not deaf yet after years of loud headphones) or blast enough bass. Then I found an old MP3 player and plugged them in. WOW! I had to turn it down half way! The only headphones I've heard that really beats the bass in these (in the price range) are the Skullcandy Skull Crushers. Definitely worth the buy.

As for working out, it depends on what I'm doing. Anything which involves laying down is a little tricky (bench press, skullcrushers - not related to the headphones lol - as the band can slip off and that is a little awkward when you are holding heavy weights. Anything standing or sitting upright is no problem.
For running, I can deal. They don't slip BUT you're going to feel like your ears are in a sauna. They are going to sweat a LOT. If that's a feeling you can't deal with, don't use them solely for working out with.

I have somewhat small ears so these are more like an over ear than on ear fit for me. They stay pretty comfy for a long time.

Overall, would recommend!

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8:
I wished the earpads are bigger and more comfortable. I would prefer velour over the ear pads instead of over this non-breathable material that's on so many earphones in this price range. I guess I should have gotten a 50mm driver instead.  The sound is ok but I don't think it's as great as other reviewers on Amazon thinks. I don't know what they are comparing it to, but this is definitely not the "best ever".

Bluetooth does work and sounds as good as wired. I liked the fact it has a wire connection as a backup when the battery runs out. Speaking of which, the battery on this thing is quite good, it'll last whole day easily but considering how uncomfortable it is for me, I wouldn't wear this for more than an hour or two at a time.

column4: Skullcandy Hesh 2 Over-Ear Wireless Headphones, 15 Hr Battery, Microphone, Works with iPhone Android and Bluetooth Devices - Black
column8: I have wired Bose headphones and this Skullcandy headphone sounds every bit has good. All frequencies are flat natural, no pumped up base or treble. It's better to customize your sound with an equalizer if you need it anyway. I did not notice any frequency loss between wired and wireless, but the wired sound is a wee bit more amplified. The volume is still more than plenty using it in Bluetooth mode, unless you want to lose your hearing. I use it with an iPod. This is the best price for quality wireless headphones. But beware, you may find it for less elsewhere. I got mine for $99 at Target, but they were very hard to find when I was looking. They were sold out at most Targets and everywhere else. The Camo's are $99 here. I suspect they must not be popular in that motif. I prefer the black because unless you are hunting or on combat duty, camo is ridiculous. You won't be sorry to own these.
