column4: Nikon D3200 24.2 MP CMOS Digital SLR with 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 Auto Focus-S DX VR NIKKOR Zoom Lens (Black) (OLD MODEL)
column8:
As stated in the title, the D3200 is the perfect entry-level DSLR camera for the hobbyist dissatisfied with simplistic Coolpix-esque point-and=shoots and those looking to get their feet wet in the great, big, expensive world of photography. Naturally, I got the red one. The lens it comes with is adequate and will suit the needs of the average beginner, but by no means should the 18-55mm be your go-to. Invest in your glass. Bodies will inevitably be replaced, but your glass is forever. I recommend your grab a solid zoom lens before you do a prime lens. Anyway, the D3200 offers what you'd expect from a DSLR: manual mode, portrait mode, sport mode, point-and-shoot mode, continuous shooting (4FPS), timer-based shooting, etc.

A couple draw backs would be its mediocre low-light performance and acceptable-grade processing even with high-performance SD cards. I would refrain from using th is camera during fast-paced and.or dark shooting situations seeing as it isn't quite there in performance. Though I love my D3200, I recently replaced it with a far better camera for this reason and the work load I have taken. But make no mistake. This camera is my workhorse. Or beater. The pictures below were all taken with my D3200 (and adjusted in Lightroom). If you're seeking a newer entry-level DSLR definitely give the D3400 a look.

column8: In the ever-evolving realm of audio technology, finding a pair of headphones that seamlessly combines style, comfort, and unparalleled sound quality can be a daunting task. However, the Tozo HT2 Bluetooth Over-Ear Headphones have effortlessly risen to the occasion, setting a new standard for what enthusiasts can expect from a premium audio accessory. As a devoted audiophile, I find myself enchanted by the magic that these headphones bring to my music, making each listening experience nothing short of extraordinary.One of the first things that captivates you upon unboxing the Tozo HT2 Bluetooth Over-Ear Headphones is their elegant design. The marriage of form and function is evident in every detail, from the sleek, minimalist exterior to the sturdy yet lightweight build. The headphones exude a sense of luxury, a testament to the meticulous craftsmanship that went into their creation.Comfort is paramount during extended listening sessions, and the plush ear cushions and adjustable headband of these headphones deliver in spades. Whether you're immersed in a marathon gaming session, catching up on podcasts, or simply enjoying your favorite tunes, the ergonomic design ensures that you can wear these headphones for hours on end without experiencing any discomfort.Seamless connectivity is a hallmark of the Tozo HT2 Bluetooth Over-Ear Headphones. The Bluetooth pairing process is quick and hassle-free, allowing you to effortlessly connect to your devices and dive into a world of immersive sound. The range is impressive, providing stable connectivity even when you stray a bit too far from your connected device.Battery life is equally impressive, making these headphones the ideal companion for long journeys, commutes, or all-day work sessions. With an extended battery life that goes the distance, you won't find yourself constantly searching for a charging outlet. The convenience of a long-lasting battery ensures that these headphones are ready to elevate your auditory experience whenever and wherever you are.Here's where the Tozo HT2 Bluetooth Over-Ear Headphones truly shine  the audio quality is nothing short of breathtaking. The precision-engineered drivers deliver a rich, well-balanced soundstage with deep bass, clear mids, and crisp highs. Whether you're a bass aficionado, a classical music enthusiast, or someone who appreciates the nuances of a well-produced podcast, these headphones cater to a diverse range of audio preferences.The noise isolation capabilities of the headphones create a cocoon of sound, allowing you to immerse yourself fully in your chosen audio without being disrupted by external noise. The immersive experience is further enhanced by the 3D sound technology, which adds a layer of depth and realism to your favorite content. From the subtlest details to the thunderous beats, the Tozo HT2 headphones deliver an audio experience that transcends expectations.The headphones also boast an array of additional features that elevate the user experience. The built-in microphones for active noise cancellation ensures crystal-clear call quality, and the ability to manually connect seamlessly between devices adds a layer of convenience for those who juggle multiple gadgets throughout the day.Investing in a pair of headphones is a commitment, and the Tozo HT2 Bluetooth Over-Ear Headphones are built to withstand the test of time. The combination of high-quality materials and superior construction ensures durability without compromising on style. The foldable design adds a layer of portability, making these headphones the perfect travel companion.In conclusion, the Tozo HT2 Bluetooth Over-Ear Headphones are a triumph in the world of audio technology. They seamlessly blend style, comfort, and exceptional sound quality to create an immersive auditory experience that will delight even the most discerning audiophiles. Whether you're a music enthusiast, a gamer, or someone who simply values high-quality audio, these headphones are a worthy investment that will undoubtedly stand the test of time. Immerse yourself in the symphony of sound that the Tozo HT2 headphones provide  it's an experience that will redefine the way you listen to your favorite content.

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column8: My initial impression when I put these on was that the ear cups were a bit small for my ears and they sounded good but the base was a bit punchy / pronounced.After wearing them for awhile, I decided that although my ears touched the sides they cups are quite cushy and surprisingly comfortable.I can wear these for hours without discomfort.I also decided that I liked the sound and wore them for several hours enjoying music and listening to a podcast that day.I'm going to compare the sound and ANC quality to several other headphones / earbuds that I own - Bose QC II earbuds, TOZO Golden X1 earbuds and Sennheiser Momentum 3 headphones.I had no problem getting them paired to my phone and connected in the TOZO app.On first connection to the app, it found a firmware update and that got installed with out issue.This is what I expect but there are other products (notably the Bose QC IIs) that bluetooth and app connections can be an issue.The controls are intuitive and easy to use.I've found this to be true with all of the TOZO products that I've tried.Sound quality:I like listening to them.The highs are crips and the base is punchy with out being muddy.I notice that compared to my Sennheiser's especially, the HT2s sound a but closed in - the Sennheiser's and the Bose both feel more expansive - have a wider soundstage.The HT2s have a wider soundstage than the Golden X1s tho.This is kinda expected tho - both the QC II and the Momentum 3's cost 5-6 times more than the HT2s.Excellent sound for the price.ANC:I found the HT2's ANC to be just OK.They perform similarly to my Momentum 3's.I tested using fan noise - a bathroom fan as well as a speaker playing music.The QC IIs are the gold standard here - they almost completely blocked out the fan noise as well as the music.The Momentum 3s and the HT2s blocked maybe 1/2 of the fan noise.I noticed that they both blocked almost all of the lower frequency fan noise but let thru the higher frequencies.The performance using music was similar - again lower frequencies were attenuated more than high ones.The Golden X1s ANC was marginally worse in both categories although similar.Bose generally wins this contest.Pass thru mode:Again the Bose performed the best but I was quite happy with the pass thru mode for the HT2s.I could easily carry on a conversation in pass thru mode without taking them off of my head.Similar to music, the HT2s were very similar to the Momentum 3's and slightly better than the Golden X1s.Bottom line - these are definitely worth the asking price.Good sound, comfortable, OK ANC and good pass thru mode.

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column7: Great product, great look, great price!
column8: Overall summary for these headphones (purchased in khaki color): I definitely recommend them, especially as a WAY more affordable dupe to Beats that look just as good. Cant speak for longevity since Ive only had them a few weeks but I have other TOZO Bluetooth headphones that are still going strong so Im confident that these will too.Now the detailsMy main purpose for buying these were for use at the gym, which they work great. Im someone who likes my music pretty loud, especially while working out, and the volume on these can get there while still sounding clear - even when battling the loudness from a really busy gym. Even though I saw the features for noise cancellation and microphone prior to buying, they again werent the real purpose I bought them. However, Ive been so impressed with both of these features as well, especially the noise cancellation capabilities, so Im getting a lot more use than I expected out of these.As someone whose cell phone lives on low battery, Im terrible about charging any & all electronics so I appreciate the battery life for these headphones so far. Cant speak for how long it takes to fully charge since I left it to charge overnight, but Ive had these for a few weeks and have only had to charge them once.The look of these is way more expensive than they actually are. The monochromatic matte khaki color is perfect. I dont always trust the pictures and was concerned it might be too yellow but its definitely not at all. Its true-to-color when compared to the listing photos. (Side note to TOZO, please release a dark brown version of these)For comfort, I do have pretty small ears but these fully cover my ear so the cushion part is not sitting on top of my ear but instead around it - which really makes them a lot more comfortable for me. I havent had to wear them for longer than an hour consecutively but have had no issue with comfort during thattime.

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column8: Disclaimer: TOZO gifted these headphones to me. Even so, the following comments are without bias.Build: The phones appear to be well built. The headband adjusts with a clicks that feel solid yet unforced. They sport a sleek and clean look.Comfortability: My previous set of headphones were Logitech H600s. Compared to those, the TOZO unit is larger and heavier. However, the fit is much better and the larger earpads make for a vastly superior feel. I have a smaller head, and the phones fit snuggly, which I like. I'm not sure how comfortable they would be on a larger dome.Sound quality: I am not an audiophile, but I do enjoy good sound quality. If there is anything that bugs me, it's tinny sound. These phone do not suffer from that malady. The bass is warm and solid and the highs are crystal. The sound is several factors better than the H600 headset. In this area, these phones far outperformed my expectations.Microphone: The phones have a built-in microphone that is adequate for communication, but not for professional recording. Audio from the mic sounds a bit like you're in a cave. To be honest, not much can be expected from a mic in any headphone, however.Latency: There is absolutely no noticeable latency in these phones. I am beyond impressed.Noise Canceling / App: I was completely surprised when I discovered the TOZO app and linked them up to the phones. The app provides six noise-canceling modes that work beautifully. I have dogs that bark from time to time and I can clearly tell when their racket is being canceled out. Change the mode and ambient sound is mixed in with my content. Further, once the device is added to the app, you can change modes even when the phones are paired to a different device. Simply brilliant.Other notes: I have not used the headphones long enough to drain the battery yet, so I have no real data on how long a single charge lasts. I have listened for over four hours, however, and had more than 50% charge left at that point. Also, I have only had these for a little more than a week. Sometimes the performance and durability of electronic devices degrades over time. I plan to update the review after several months of use.Overall value: The purchase price of $39 is right in the range of similar headphones on Amazon. That being said, I do not know how they line up to the competition in quality. It's hard to imagine better performance at this price range, however. I am quite satisfied with them.

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column7: Great Headphones, Noise Cancelling is Not Great
column8: If you want a full over the ear headphones these are a great buy. The price is right for the overall quality, design, battery life and more. It seems with Tozo you can expect to get top notch technology at affordable and reasonable pricing. A high value set of headphones that competes, spec wise, with significantly more expensive headphones. The nice thing about over the ear headphones like these is the overall sound field is much more immersive. There tends to be a broader range and richness to the sound that is much harder to expect from earbuds. This probably has a lot to do with the much larger diameter speaker drivers.Battery life appears to be really good thus far.The headphones do collapse which makes them easier for packing and travel. Though they're still much more bulky than earbuds.Some negatives with these headphones. The ANC (noise cancelling) feature is weak compared to earbuds I have with ANC. So poor that there's almost no distinguishable difference when it's on or off. There's also a pass through feature which allows you to hear external noise (which is very helpful in conversations). That works much better than the ANC feature.Overall, these are a great value for the price with excellent, rich sound.

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column8: When it comes to high-quality headphones, the TOZO HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones go head-to-head with the renowned Bose QC35.**Sound Quality: TOZO HT2 (5/5) vs. Bose QC35 (4.5/5)**The TOZO HT2 offers Hi-Res Audio and a customizable EQ via its dedicated app, providing an edge in tailoring the sound profile to individual preferences. While the Bose QC35 delivers impressive sound, the TOZO HT2's deep bass and personalized audio tuning via the app give it a slight advantage for those seeking a truly immersive listening experience.**Active Noise Cancellation: TOZO HT2 (5/5) vs. Bose QC35 (4.8/5)**Both headphones excel in active noise cancellation, but the TOZO HT2's hybrid ANC technology stands out with its adjustable noise-canceling feature. This flexibility allows users to find the perfect balance between blocking out external noise and staying aware of their surroundings, giving the TOZO HT2 a slight edge in versatility.**Battery Life: TOZO HT2 (5/5) vs. Bose QC35 (4.5/5)**The TOZO HT2 dominates in the battery life department with an impressive 60 hours of playtime, outshining the Bose QC35. This extended battery life makes the TOZO HT2 a compelling choice for those who prioritize long-lasting performance during travel or extended use.**Comfort and Design: TOZO HT2 (5/5) vs. Bose QC35 (4.7/5)**Both headphones prioritize comfort, with plush padding and ergonomic designs. However, the TOZO HT2's foldable design and slightly lighter build enhance its portability, making it a tad more convenient for on-the-go users compared to the Bose QC35.**Connectivity and Controls: TOZO HT2 (5/5) vs. Bose QC35 (4.8/5)**Bluetooth connectivity is seamless on both models, but the TOZO HT2's touch-sensitive controls on the ear cups offer an intuitive and user-friendly experience. The Bose QC35's controls are excellent but fall slightly behind in terms of responsiveness compared to the TOZO HT2.**Conclusion:**In the clash of titans, the TOZO HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones emerge as a formidable contender against the Bose QC35. With superior battery life, customizable sound profiles, and intuitive touch controls, the TOZO HT2 stands out as an excellent choice for those seeking a perfect blend of performance and versatility in their audio experience.

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column7: Amazing! Great value and excellent performance so far
column8: Full disclosure: I received a very large discount for these from TOZO.I have tested several TOZO products in the past. The quality has steadily been improving for their products. I am comparing these with my Sony WH-1000XM5 headphones, which I consider the top of the line benchmark. I have owned the Bose QC before and Sony takes the prize. While the Sony XM5's beat out the TOZO HT2s, it is not by a huge margin as many would think. Given that the TOZO headphones are just $49.99, this is a huge value.Sound: The HT2s come very close to replicating the sound of the XM5s. Tozo has an app that allows you to adjust the equalizer like Sony. There are a bunch of preset settings, butthe equalizer allows you to adjust the settings based on what you like the most and based on what types of music you listen to. For reference, I am streaming on a Samsung S21 Ultra with LDAC enabled and streaming Dolby Atmos quality songs from Amazon Music.Noise cancelling: The way the XM5s fit around the ear does a little better job than the HT2s, but it is not by a large margin. The transparency mode for the HT2s is also very clear. Full disclosure, I have not yet tested these for phone calls. But given the accurate transparent mode, they will probably sound great for phone calls, like the XM5s.Comfort: The XM5s still have a significant leg up in terms of comfort. While you could probably wear the XM5s for 3-4 hours with no discomfort, the HT2s could probably go for 1-2 hours. This is still fantastic for $50 headphones. If you're watching a movie on a plane, I'm sure you could go for 2-3 hours and not notice much discomfort. But if you want to use noise-cancelling and sleep, you may notice it more. The HT2s just feel a little bit too snug. But they are also probably less likely to fall off.The HT2s don't come with a case, but at $50 this is still a good value. The battery seems to last a very long time. The Bluetooth connection seems just as good as on the XM5s.Summary: TOZO reminds me of how far KIA cars have come relative to Toyota from 2005 until now. The HT2s are legitimate contenders in the over the ear headphones space that we should take seriously, especially at $50.

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column8: I will admit that I am biased for Tozo.I have several Tozo products and have been impressed with all of them.Usually I prefer to listen using an "open" type of earphone or ear bud so I can be aware of my surroundings.(For this experience I recommend the Tozo Open Buds.) But there are times that you want to really shut out the ambient sound and be immersed in youraudio.The H2 fills this bill nicely at a price much lower than you would pay for this level of quality build and performance.When you put them on and hold the top button for a few seconds you will get a chime letting you know they're on.This same top button will serve to pause or resume the music,answer a phone call,or turn off the power.Leave them on as long as you like with no discomfort or irritation.The noise cancelling is one of the best features.I use them while riding my indoor bike and they actually do cancel out almost all of the sound of the chain and wheel spinning.Battery lasts all day if need be and is charged via Type C cable,included in the box of course.No problem with Bluetooth connecting which is instantaneousbut there's also a place to plug in a 3.5 cable if you are listening to a device that doesn't have Bluetooth.One more thing:Download the Tozo app to your phone and use it to customize the bass/treble functions to customize the sound of your favorite music.I don't think you can beat the H2 at even a much higher price;at this price they are truly a superior value.

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column8: The Tozo HT2 is a great, budget-friendly headphone/headset! At the time I got them, they were $50 with a $10 off coupon, so I figured Id give them a try since Ive had prior experience with Tozo productsspecifically, the T10 Bluetooth earbuds. If youre curious, I still use the T10 earbuds everyday for running, working out, and walking my dog. But as expected, the HT2 is another fantastic product made by Tozo.Ive had these headphones for exactly a week now and can say that I am more than impressed by their quality! The first thing that you will notice is the packaging. It is very sleek and modern. Inside the box, youll find the headphones, a quick instructions guide, a slightly more in-depth instructional pamphlet, some promotional material for their App and warranty, a ~2-foot USB-C cable, and a ~3-4 foot aux cable with 1/8th inch ends. The HT2 feels like it is made of pretty good quality plastic. The speakers are marked L and R for easy identification and are surrounded by comfy foam. The right speaker has four buttons, including the power button, a connected + and  button for controlling the volume (Im counting these as two separate buttons), and a noise-canceling (NC) button.Holding the power button for about three seconds will turn the headphones on/off. Syncing the headphones was incredibly fast and easy. In mere seconds, I was listening to music. I ended up downloading the Tozo App, which allows you to play with the settings so you can customize things like the bass, mid-tones, and treble.The first time messing with the settings, I couldnt tell if it was affecting the sound. Turns out, I had to update it. Here is one of the few cons of the HT2, updating the headphones through the App took about 10 minutes, which is fine. However, upon clicking on the Update tab, it doesnt give you a warning pop-up or anything, it just starts updating, and during that time, you have to keep the headphones and phone powered on. The App says not to exit from it while it is updating either, so for about 10 minutes, I had to stare at a loading screen while worrying about whether my phone would go into sleep mode if I wasnt constantly tapping at it. However, since the update, the headphones respond to the customization settings. Speaking of which, the customization settings are pretty in-depth and have about 10 points where you can articulate to your preference. I typically just use the default settings, but I can see people getting into it and editing their settings for specific types of music. But lets get into the HT2s sound quality and use case scenarios!The HT2 has great mid and treble tones but seems to be lacking in bass. That being said, I think the sound quality is truly outstanding. I listen to an eclectic range of music and found these headphones doing each genre justice. You can pick out and hear every instrument of a song, and vocals are crisp. These headphones are also good for podcasts as well. Ive probably put around 25 hours of listening time with these and havent noticed anything weird regarding crackling, noise interference, disconnects, etc. Ive also only charged these twice; the battery is pretty incredible, though Id imagine it will degrade over time. Currently though, pretty good. The range is also good. I can go anywhere within my apartment (not big, about 850 square feet) and stay connected, even with doors closed/in other rooms. The Noise-Canceling function is pretty good, though it wont block out loud noises completely, just muffles them. That being said, it made functions like vacuuming and using my food processor less noisy (for me at least lol). I did find them capable of blocking out moderate noises, such as office banter at work. The Noise-Canceling button switches from Noise-Canceling (default), to off, to something called Pass Through which Im not entirely sure what it does, but it seems like it allows noise from outside to be hearable, whereas turning the NC off just seems like you have earmuffs on and can dully hear noise from outside. Since I am on the subject of the Noise-Canceling function for these headphones, I will say that the button placement is kind of weird. When looking at the right speaker head-on, the NC button is at around the 4 oclock position. The first few times taking the headphones off, I found myself accidentally pressing the button. Eventually, I changed the placement of my fingers when taking them off to avoid this. However, the NC button is very sensitive and doesnt take much force to activate/change the setting. For example, just taking off the headphones and laying it on a flat surface will often press the button in. This can be jarring when putting the headphones back on after having them off briefly, but not long enough to warrant shutting them off completely. Another minor con I found with these headphones is that they suffer from sound leakage/bleeding. This means that when in use, whatever youre listening to can be heard from outside. Apparently, this is common for overhead headphones (not earbuds), so thats why I find this to be a minor issue. That being said, if you work with others in a quiet setting, you might want to either listen at a lower volume or use other headphones/earbuds.So besides listening to music/podcasts/stuff, what else can these things do? Although Ive only had them for a week, I was able to do some unconventional testing. These headphones act as a headset and have a built-in mic. Turns out, the mic works pretty well. I didnt use these to make a phonecall, but I tested them by syncing to my laptop to do video meetings for work. I didnt hear any mentions of them sounding bad or cutting out. The audio from meetings was good too, no echoing, or disturbances that you may get with lesser-quality headsets.Another thing that I tried with these (though I dont recommend) is audio editing. I used these to edit some sound files through Adobe Audition 2024 and noticed a lot of latency. Granted, this is a problem that affects most Bluetooth headsets. That being said, since these headphones come with an Aux and USB-C cable, Im sure I could have used either to connect directly to my computer and eliminate that latency.Something cool I decided to do with these headphones is to use the Aux cable to jack into a quarter () inch adapter and into my old Line 6 Spider IV 15-watt practice amp. Turns out, it actually worked! The sound wasnt that great, but I only spent about five minutes messing around. I was more curious to see if it would work. Im sure if I put in some time, I could have made it sound better though. Maybe something worth updating on later.One thing that I havent been able to do with these (that will also warrant touching upon in a later update) is using these for gaming. The reason being is that I have a PS5 and apparently it requires an adapter/dongle to use Bluetooth devices.To wrap things up, the Tozo HT2 headphones are surprisingly high-quality for a low cost. The sound quality is excellent, though it lacks heavy bassif that is important to you. The battery life is also really good. Though I didnt touch upon it, wearing these headphones for longer periods is pretty comfortable. Typically, I find headphones to squeeze/hurt my ears after about an hour, but Ive been able to keep these on for around four hours before I felt I needed to take them off. The Aux and USB-C cables allow you to directly connect to sources, allowing for flexibility and opening new doors for using these headphones. Though these headphones have some minor drawbacks (NC button sensitivity, weird/long App/headphone updating process, and sound leakage/bleeding), the overall value you get from the HT2s is more than worth the price.12/30/23 - UpdateI used the AUX cable to connect the headphones directly to my PS5 controller and they work great! Especially nice when my downstairs neighbor's dogs are barking nonstop. With that being said, I don't play multiplayer games, so I can't tell you how well the microphone works online or if it defaults to the microphone built into the controller.

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column7: Lightweight, Comfortable, Good Sound, Easy Controls, Quality ANC
column8: These are great over-the-ear headphones--a big improvement over my Cowin set.I like these for a bunch of reasons:1. They weight only 8 ounces (Cowin weighs 9 oz, which is 12% heavier, which makes a big difference when you're wearing them for an extended period of time such as watching a movie)2. The ear padding and head pad are really soft and comfortable--nicer than my Cowin set.3. The ANC (noise-cancelling) is very good and comfortable. What I like about the TOZO (both these headphones and the earbuds) is that when ANC is on and I'm not listening to anything (it's quiet) I do NOT get a nauseous feeling--especially when I turn my head.With my Cowin and most other ANC headphones I have tried, I get a queasy feeling when I turn the ANC on and have no audio playing and it gets worse when I turn my head--a bit like vertigo.So, these TOZO's are a vast improvement for me not to have that vertigo/nausea!4. They talk to you.The headphones have a pleasant voice and tones that tell you what you're doing with the controls and connecting up on Bluetooth.It plays a tone when you turn them on or off.It makes another tone when it's looking for a Bluetooth source to connect to. It makes a 3rd tone when it connects and syncs with a device, and then sound starts playing (if the device is playing audio).It tells you what ANC mode you are in:"ANC On", "ANC Off", "Pass Through"(Pass Through mode is where the headphones slightly amplify the sound on the external microphone to make it almost like you're not wearing the headphones).That said, I think I like how the earbuds work better than the headphones in this regard, as the earbuds say "Power On/Off", "Pairing", and "Connected" instead of using tones, so it's easier to understand what the earbuds are doing.5. The controls are straightforward.There is an on/off button (with a raised "O" on it for ease of finding it with your fingers without having to take the headphones off and look at the buttons to see what they do), volume control (with a raised "+" and recessed "-" where the "+" is on the upper side of that button and the "-" is on the lower side of the button--versus the Cowin where the volume up button was on the lower side of the button and the volume down button was on the upper side of the button), and a button for cycling through the ANC modes.6. A big complaint I have had with headphones for decades was having to figure out which side was left and right. All of them had a tiny L or R located somewhere on each earpiece, but they were ALL difficult to see because they were always small and were the same color as the earpiece--and especially hard to see the L or R in low lighting.These TOZO have a *large* L and R inside each earpiece making it really easy to know which side is which.See the attached picture.There is also the standard tiny L and R on the hinge point for each earpiece, both those are also difficult to see and thus not as useful as the large L and R inside the earpieces.7. I like how the headphones fold up pretty flat and are not as bulky to store as those headphones that don't fold up.See the attached picture.8. The sound is good. I've watched a few movies and TV shows and the stereo separation is very good, the sound is clean and crisp.9. The ANC works well in damping out exterior sounds, and it is easy to tell the difference between the 3 ANC modes with these headphones.I also tried using these headphones to make a call on my cellphone.It worked okay but not great. The audio on the call was good, but I was told by my callee that the microphone pickup was staticky and somewhat weak and I made the call from inside the house with no other noise.Also, it just 'felt' weird listening to myself when I spoke as it felt to me like my voice was a bit disembodied.So, while we could do the call, it seems the earbuds are a better choice for making calls than the headphones. This is a really minor nit to pick, since I can't really imagine people would be walking around making calls with these headphones on anyway.My experience with TOZO support has been very good--certainly superior to most other companies.They respond to queries quickly and clearly.They are interested in addressing your concerns and making you a happy (and hopefully repeat) customer.

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column8: I'm only giving these 3 stars, but there's a lot to like about them.Pros: - Price - Sound quality:very good treble, good mid-range, plenty of good bass, but not great bass; when I turn up the bass in the EQ where I like it, I felt like it lost a little bit of punch and added a little bit of muddiness.Again, good bass, and plenty of it, just not great bass. - App:looks good, connects every time, updates the headphone firmware (there was a firmware update available out of the box, took 8-10 minutes), and a 10-band EQ that the headphones are very responsive to, as well as 16 EQ presets you can choose from. - Controls:simple, easy to find with your finger, easy to use.The ANC button cycles through ANC off, ambient mode, and ANC on, none of the other ANC modes. - ANC:between the passive noise-blocking of the ear-cups and the active noise cancellation of the headphones, the noise isolation is great, low to high.I vacuumed for about an hour wearing these, and they blocked more of the vacuum noise than my Tozo X1s, and when my cats meowed at me I 100% couldn't here, them (with music playing).I haven't tried the adaptive noise cancellation, the wind noise reduction or the leisure mode on these. - Comfortable:my first session was 2 hours and 15 minutes, no problem wearing them, no particular pressure on the top of my head from the band or on my ears.The ear cups are big enough to fully surround my ears (without looking particularly big) so the cups press against my head not my ears.Also, I wear glasses; absolutely no issue.I think Tozo got the size and pressure just right for the size of my head (average, as far as I know). - The ear cups rotate flat, or you can bend them in towards the band, so they will fit in cases of ether type. - Wired operation:I haven't actually tried it, but I think that's a must-have for headphones.Cons: - The microphone is bad.I test a lot of earbuds, and a few headphones, and I called my standard microphone tester (my sister) and she immediately couldn't understand what I was saying.When I asked her how the microphone was, after she understood me the second or third time, she said, "terrible, the worst of any you've tried."Middling: - The earcups seal very well around your ears, so your ears get pretty warm.I think that's pretty typical of headphones that passively block a lot of noise, but understand that before you buy:I took them off after 2 hours and 15 minutes and there were just drops of sweat on the earcups.Again, I think that's normal. - Battery life:after 2hrs and 15 minutes at about 55% volume with standard ANC on, I had dropped to 88% battery, suggesting 18-19 hours of play time.Not bad, but nowhere close to the 60 hours in the Amazon listing. - No high resolution codecs that I could see, and none in the Amazon listing, so no idea why the listing says Hi-Res Audio Certification.I'm not missing them, I think the sound is good, just thought I would mention that.Overall, the bad microphones kill these for me, I need headphones and earbuds to be good for music and calls both.If your priority is sound quality for low cost, I think these are good, but if you need to make calls you should look elsewhere.

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column8: The media could not be loaded.Start off by saying that I bought this because I do own a previous tozo product (earbuds) that I loved and ride hard for because they are so good but ended up accidentally washing them. I was going to repurchase those earbuds but I did know I also wanted headphones since my earbuds tend to fall out when I go hard in the gym. I saw the reviews and decided ok Ill give it a try.First off, as soon as I put these on the noise cancelling is really no joke, its wild. I couldnt hear anything and it was great. The headphones itself was comfortable. It wasnt too hard on my head and the cushion support on my ears are the best parts.Second, in the video I am using max volume so you can hear the music leakage from the headphones. I do listen to different genres of music, from jazz to edm, hip hop to r&b, acoustic to pop, so I put on many different songs and the bass is really good. Although Im not surprised because I loved there tozo earbuds I had for nearly a year until I washed it :,(. For the price this is really nice. The only reason I cant give it 5 stars is because Im not a fan of music leakage. I love the color and everything about this product. I do know that it only happens when you listen at max volume and when I tested lowering maybe 3 bars on my iPhone, the music leak isnt that bad and its really faint which is what another reviewer said so yeah if you listen at max thats when youll get louder leak.UPDATE:After having this pair for a couple of weeks now, I will be returning them. At the gym, I took off my headphones to see if the noise leaking will be heard by others, I didnt actually hear the leak; I even turned up the volume on the pair and held the headphones up to hear closer. Still noticing. Keep in mind my gym also plays music. The main reason I will be returning them is because while I was working out, they kept sliding off. I never adjusted it. As you can see the headphones sit perfectly fine on my head but its too big around my ears causing them to slide off with extensive movement.The cushion is comfortable and the color is really cute although its not worth it in my option to keep headphones that are too big and constantly move or slide off with extensive movement.I will be returning them unfortunately

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column8: Pictured is the TOZO HT2. The physical build is good and the button placement is logical. The ear pad material is a bit loose and I worry it will wear in time.The sound quality is impressive for an inexpensive set of headphones like these. The bass comes through and they compares well against higher quality headphones I used for comparison.Unfortunately, the HT2 ANC is a bit off. After a few weeks, I started experiencing the sensation of pressure on the right side only. Eventually I get used to it, but it's certainly noticeable. I do NOT experience this issue with another higher quality headphone set used for comparison. I think these may be malfunctioning. (Note: Experiencing the feeling of "pressure" is not unusual for some people when using ANC headphones. Some people simply cannot comfortably use ANC headphones for this reason.)The HT2 ANC feature was the first time I've used such technology and it was magical. For the price, these headphones provide fair cancellation.They are 4-star headphones, but I'm rating them 3-stars because of the right ear issue.

column8: Got these TODAY from Amazon.For the price, there are a lot of positive things about these headphones.The quality is good, the sound is better than you can normally find in the 40-50 dollar Bluetooth price range (much less, with moderate noise cancelling).These would be a keeper...except for one HUGE and random flaw .. the headphones will randomly initiate a redial the last number on your Iphone.No warning, no idea how to disable this amazingly ill conceived and random "feature", nothing in the TOZO tiny user manual regarding this AT ALL ... Just listen to a podcast at midnight, bump the headphone in some indeterminate and random way... and your headphones are dialing the last number dialed on the Iphone(for me, my elderly parents).Won't EVER be using these headphones again.Another example of ... if a deal (and the other user reviews) look too good to be true.I don't know if this is just an issue with TOZO and Iphones, but it happened day one after purchase...twice.Two thumbs down.Straight to the trash.

The overall sound quality is good and I like the adjustable bass. I can still use them for gaming but have to plug them in in order to use them for that which isnt bad just not exactly what I wanted. I like that they fit on my very small head and arent too heavy or tight.

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column8: The headphone feels premium compared to the price, comfortable to wear, and has decent sound. ANC and transparency are just OK, definitely not in the level of Sony or Bose, which are a lot more expensive.However, I think my NC7 (updated in 2022) sounds better, the NC7 is louder, has better Bass, has fuller sound, and better treble, even though it's not an over the ear headphone like the HT2.Also, my HT2 does not have the option to change the touch controls in the Tozo App (using a S23+ phone) which is a bit disappointing, as seen in the attached image, wish it will be included in a future app update.Overall, a great purchase.

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column8: I don't typically write reviews, though this is the second TOZO product I've gotten that I was impressed with. Before, I was looking for an alternative to AirPods Pro and I found the TOZO NC2s and was very satisfied with them. The only con was a little white noise in transparency mode, which I quickly got used to anyway. Then I saw that they had these over-the-ear HT2s and figured I'd give them a shot. At the price, they are unmatched. There's improvement all around, including Transparency mode. It's just different because you do have something covering your whole ear. It's just something different to get used to. I enjoy that there are multiple noise cancelling modes, that the app is pretty robust, that there are OTA updates that can continually improve these headphones, and how comfortable/light they are. The only con I can see right now is that Transparency mode cannot be gotten to through the physical buttons. You have to be in the app. However, this is likely something that can come with an update, so hopefully that's coming in the future. I'm still giving these 5 stars because these headphones are just impressive overall. If they release newer ones, I'll probably be in line to get them and enjoy them.Edit: I paired these to my Steam Deck and other non-mobile devices and noticed pretty bad latency. After changing to other compatible codec profiles, the latency did not improve. These headphones are still quite good, though I believe these are for the casual user that wants them for one device. Its disappointing that they have multipoint capability, but youll experience different latency as there appears to be limited codec support. Ill be on the hunt for different headphones that better suit my needs, but these are still good headphones. Just proceed with caution and make a more informed decision where you can.

Nothing fancy about them, but a good, solid listening experience on a budget.

Using the app allowed for an extended conversation with their representative who patiently and kindly helped find the issue with the headphones. column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column8: My existing over-ear headphones are the wired kind and very old, so I was excited to try this product. The sound quality and noise cancellation is amazing. They are also very comfortable to wear. They were easy to use, with actual buttons to press. At first I had difficulty getting the battery to charge all the way, though now the issue seems to be worked out so that it gives many hours of use. I often have trouble with the bluetooth connection, and it usually requires 2-3 attempts to get connected. Because of these latter issues I unfortunately have to deduct a star, though these will remain my headphones of choice when using my desktop computer.

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column8: The headphones themselves are built well, providing a snug fit. The audio quality was okay, but initially, the bass was lacking, and I had to adjust the sound settings to achieve the sound quality I preferred. The microphone is adequate, not the best, but sufficient. Remarkably, the noise cancelling does not block out all sounds, but it does eliminate a good majority of them. The battery life seems to perform well; however, I have never used the headphones until the battery ran out, but the battery life is good. They are pretty durable, but I have not subjected them to anything too extreme. For the price they are, the earphones are a good pair to have.

column7: Extremely comfy and immersive great sound
column8: The sleek and quality look and feel of this TOZO HT2 already impressed me right after I opened its nicely designed packaging box.The ear pads are amazingly comfortable, and I can wear them for hours without feeling hot or humid in my ears. The breathable yet plush foam is quite different from other fully covered over-ear headphones. I just snugged it in, and it fits perfectly while being adjustable.The sound is immersive and indeed high fidelity, with excellent bass, treble, and mid-range.The battery lasts quite long, and I havent needed to recharge it after using it for almost 10 days.The only reason I gave it a 4-star rating is that its noise cancellation didnt seem to work well. I couldnt tell much difference in external noise when the ANC was on or off, except that the sound was definitely far better when ANC was on.That said, its truly an amazing over-ear headphone, and I highly recommend it!

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column7: ANC works only on Bluetooth connections
column8: These are very nice headphones, especially considering the cost. But I have one gripe that keeps me from giving it 5 stars. If you use them with a wired connection, the active noise cancelation function is turned off, according to the User Guide. Why? This means I won't be able to use them on my digital piano, which has only headphone jacks and no Bluetooth. So, as long as you use them only on Bluetooth connections, you will have a nice pair of noise canceling headphones.

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column8: I was looking for some over ear headphones to use at work to listen to music and take video calls.The noise cancellation is good, blocks out a fair amount of background noise. Sound quality is great and no complaints there. I like that it has a headphone jack input in case you dont want to use bluetooth. I like that I can have the headphones connected to two devices at once and not have to manually connect to each one.Issues: I had some coworkers comment that the mic quality isnt great, I have not confirmed that with any other device only with my work laptop. So cant fault the headphones too much for that. Another super minor issues is when changing noise cancelation modes the voice is uses has a strong accent when saying noise cancellation on/off or passthrough. Not a problem at all just something the company could work on when selling a product to the US market.Overall im super happy with the headphones, they work for my needs, were very reasonably priced and work well. Overall I recommend the Tozo HT2

column7: The noise-cancelling feature is disabled if you listen via wire.

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column8: As a big fan of music and movies on my phone, a quality pair of headphones is a must. The TOZO HT2 headphones hit all expectations for high quality build, great sound and comfortable.The bass hits and the highs are crisp and clean. TheTOZO HT2 allow me to get lost in my music hearing details I had missed on lesser quality headphones or my phone speakers. Truely excellent!The TOZO HT2 is easily the most comfortable headphones I have used. They hug my head without being tight or hurting my ears. These can be worn for hours without any discomfort.The build seems very solid and I feel these will hold up well, though time is always the judge on that. As you can see from my photos they fold down flat and the hinges that permit that seem sturdy. Very convenient!The active noise canceling works well and you may bounce through the modes with the push of a physical button on the headphones.Lastly, I turned up my music to the loudest I would want to listen and stood right beside my wife and she could not hear the music at all. This will allow me to use these anytime without disturbing anyone else, which is a must and these nail it.Very easy to connect and use right out of the box and a seriously GREAT pair of headphones! Very pleased and I would and do highly recommend!

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column8: I'll start this review by stating the price of $49.99, $39.99 with the discount. Pictured are the Tozo HT2 and Skullcandy HESH, the HESH run around $135.The Tozo's are a bit heavier, but have ANC and you can definitely tell, even when I turn the ANC off the Tozo's are still more quiet than the HESH.Both sound equally good but seeing that the HT2 are 75% less in cost than the HESH that's super impressive. With the Tozo app you can customize the sound more, Skullcandy doesn't have an app.These are gym headphones I'm not trying to get the same sounds as I would out of some Bose headphones, not trying to sweat up $300+ headphones. Speaking of sweating the Tozo do get your ears pretty warm I'm sure it has to do with the tighter seal for ANC.For the price HT2 are DEFINITELY worth it. I feel safe to say that any headphones around $150 the HT2 will be just as good or better. I have several Tozo earbuds and have handed them down to my kids after getting these HT2. Totally worth it.UPDATE.I wore them to the gym last night, again great sound I couldn't hear any except my music with ANC on. They do shift on my head when lying down on the bench, they aren't as tight on my head as the HESH, so the band falls towards the bench and the music quality suffers, but that's to be expected. If they had a way to adjust the width tightness that would be the only improvement I can see with these headphones. Still a solid buy IMHO at $49.99.

column7: Eat your heart out Beats By Dre. For a quarter of the price!
column8: Title: Phenomenal Performance and Unmatched Battery Life!I recently purchased the TOZO HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Wireless Headphones, and I am absolutely blown away by their performance! These headphones offer a remarkable blend of cutting-edge technology and user-friendly features that make them a standout choice in the crowded audio market.First and foremost, the 60-hour battery life is a game-changer. I can go days without having to worry about recharging, making them perfect for long flights, road trips, or just extended use at home or work. The longevity of the battery is truly impressive, and it has exceeded my expectations.The Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling (ANC) is another standout feature. It effectively eliminates ambient noise, providing a serene and immersive listening experience. Whether I'm in a bustling coffee shop, on public transportation, or simply want to enjoy my music without any interruptions, the TOZO HT2 delivers on its promise of exceptional noise cancellation.What truly sets these headphones apart, though, is the customizable equalizer application. The ability to fine-tune the audio to my preferences ensures that I get the best possible sound quality for every genre of music. The equalizer app is user-friendly and allows me to tailor the audio profile to match my mood or the type of content I'm enjoying.The build quality of the headphones is also worth mentioning. They are sleek, comfortable, and foldable, making them incredibly portable. The touch controls on the ear cups are intuitive and responsive, adding to the overall user-friendly design.In conclusion, the TOZO HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Wireless Headphones have exceeded my expectations in every way. With an astounding 60-hour battery life, top-notch noise cancellation, and a customizable equalizer application, they offer a premium audio experience that is hard to beat. If you're in the market for high-quality wireless headphones for a quarter of the price of "Name Brand" overpriced Beats By Dre, look no further  the TOZO HT2 is a true gem!

column8: I've been wanting a pair of noise cancelling headphones for quite some time, I've tried a couple very expensive sets but just didn't want to spend the money, when I heard Tozo made some, I decided to give them a try since I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of their earbuds that I received as a gift some time ago.They are great, light weight, very comfortable, the sound quality is excellent, they have that quality feel, the noise cancelling takes just a second to kick in, long enough to think, oh no this isn't very good, then everything just goes away the contrast is huge.I don't feel like anything was compromised with the lower price.The controls will take a little getting used to, must buttons have more than one function, but that's becoming more common and it's nice to only have to feel around for a few buttons.No complaints.I've had to work with Tozos customer service before, they are great, they were a key factor in me being willing to give these a shot.

column7: Unbelievable amenities @ such a low price!
column8: These noice cancelling headphones are unbelievable regardless of price. I don't know what I was expecting but they blew me away!!! The active noise cancelling is equal to any of the high end head gear I've ever used. The sound quality for calls are equal to that. Only the audio when listening to music doesn't match. The quality is actually excellent for clarity and a clean even output. Volume gets loud too. My only wish is the bass would be "fatter". Like I said it's very clean and even. But not so much as far sound with bottom bass. However I didn't play with the phone app equalizer so maybe there are adjustments. Bottom line is for a quarter of the cost of the big name brands, I absolutely say grab a pair of these. I use these during the day for most activities and then put on my Skullcandy crushers when it's all about the music .I have also purchased and given several models of earbuds from this company as gifts. The price and quality make them perfect to gift. While the high end earbuds were a touch better in performance, at a fraction of their price good performance, Tozo earbuds are awesome. I've lost some and losing some for $30 ish dollars vs $200 makes it a whole lot easier to deal with loss .

I have found that fine-tuning EQ in TOZO app for a custom personalized setup is a must if one wants these to produce better-than-average sound. Once tuned up that way, they rock. column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column7: High performing over-the-ear headphones with good design and great battery life
column8: I have been a Tozo customer for a few years now and have used almost the full range of their products so I've become quite accustomed to the high level of performance and quality for the price. The Tozo HT2's continue the legacy of offering a well-designed, high-performing product for a very reasonable price. The sound quality I believe is on par with the "Gold" ear buds which is to say very good. The ANC (Active Noise Cancelling) modes work well and there are more options available if you use the Tozo app. One small gripe is the Tozo app can have troubles connecting to the headphones and I have had similar issues connecting to the Tozo bluetooth speakers and ear buds as well. But once connected there are a lot of options available for equalizer (including fully custom), and ANC on products equipped with that feature (including the HT2s). Back to the HT2s, the battery life is incredible. I used mine on a 4.5 hour flight at high volume and the battery only dropped by 20% over that time...impressive indeed. The muff design of the headphones is very comfortable and soft and is a sort of faux-leather material. I have relatively large earlobes and the muffs are big enough to cover fully outside of the lobe which is important for long-wear comfort. The controls are all on the right side muff (and the headphones are clearly labeled "L" and "R" inside of the muffs on the speaker covers). It does take a bit of getting used to feeling where the buttons are and which one does what but not bad. My only suggestion here would be to move the volume out to a spinning dial on the perimeter of the outside of the speaker body rather than having the small buttons for volume. Then the small buttons could be used solely for track advancing or reversing, skipping etc. Overall I give the headphones a 4.8/5...performance-wise they are essentially perfect, and a couple of tiny design and connectivity tweaks would bring it to a 5. I love them!

column7: Battery life is amazing. Product Is pretty muchas advertised
column8: It came Sunday at 4pm and I've been using it immediately after it came and I've been using since then, yesterday and today even while writing this review. It came charged with 92% battery( I saw it on the tozo app). I started using it as soon as it came for about 3 hours while doing laundry with noise cancelation on and it actually worked. After laundry yesterday, I was chilling streaming music for about 4 to 5 hours, went to the store, took a walk, was playing football with it on and watched my show with it. Today I've been using it all day and to cut this short, it's 43% while writing this review. It's advertised to be 60 hours with ANC off and 40 hours with ANC on, so it's safe to say the battery life is decent since I've been using it with ANC on right? Remember I've been using it all day . Its actually 1am right now so it's the third day, using it without charge. Anyways the feel and comfort is valid. Very comfortable and light weight as described. Other headphones usually leave me with some kind of pain on my ear while and after using them but this doesn't .The app comes in handy and I'm surprised it actually works and syncs well with the headphones... like it actually works.All modes works fine as described. Overall I'm impressed by the quality and features of it for $40 (well at least at the time I bought it. Highly recommend them

column8: I have a pair of ear buds, but my ears are just weird shaped and all ear buds make my ears ache after prolonged periods of time.I really wanted a pair of over the headphones so that I could give my ears a break. The few pairs Ive tried dont have big enough indents in the padding for my whole ear to fit and press on my earrings/hurt my ears, or they are too tight and put too much pressure on the sides of my heads leaving me with aching ears and a headache. I work out 3 times a day and really need a pair that doesnt bother me. These ones seem to do the trick! The ear pad indents are big enough for my whole ear and earrings to fit in. They are adjustable so you can make them longer if needed, but at the shortest theyre perfect for me. They fit well by themselves or over a beanie if Im out walking. You can rotate the ears to adjust for a flush fit.The only downsides to them are when I put them on/take them off or adjust at all, sometimes I hit a control button on them. They also dont have amazing noise canceling like my beats do, but Id rather they fit my head and not hurt than completely mute other noises. Plus when I have my music or book playing, I cant normally hear much other than maybe muffled sounds.

column7: CUTE!! Easy to connect and noise cancelling works well!
column8: CUTE!! Easy to connect and noise cancelling works well! I got these headphones because I wanted a hands free option that was more secure than ear buds. I have the TOZO wireless ear buds and I love them. I have had them for years and I still do not have issues with them so when it came time to buy headphones, I tried out the same company. column8: I had a flight coming on Sunday and I bought these on the Friday before & I received them the same day! What a time to be alive. I watched review before buying. They are practically perfect. column8: These headphones are without a doubt, my favorite headphones so far. They fit snugly but not too tightly on my head and feel relatively light so they don't make my head feel heavy but also don't slip off. Now for sound quality, it's spectacular, it has a bluetooth and wired mode which is really convenient since sometimes you like the feel of wired headphones and the marginally better quality that comes with them, and this delivers. column7: Excellent sound quality and Noise Cancelling system
column8: Tested in a commercial airplane as PAX, the Noise Cancelling (NC) works excellently, I was 4 lines behind the wing, and the engines made much noise at that position, this Tozo headset NC System canceled the noise so well, I'm impressed. The sound quality is outstanding, and the Bass and treble are good.I compared this TOZO HT2 with the BOSE A30 ($1100) and David Clark DC One X ($950) aviation headset, I didn't find a difference in the noise cancellation, nor the sound quality concerning Music and movie sound. The big difference is with the cost, Bose and David Clark are ridiculously expensive. The wire connection is useful to use in aircraft with a Media Monitor with 1/8 plugs. During testing a phone call and WhatsApp call the Left microphone heard funny, and the right Mic heard good. The folding mechanism is helpful to carry on. The ear foam is very soft and comfortable and even keeps your ears warm on a cold day. I'm very happy with this headset Model HT2.

column4: HT2 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones, 60H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio Custom EQ via App Deep Bass Comfort Fit Ear Cups, for Home Office Travel
column8: These headphones are comparable to much more expensive competitors and blow any others at this price point out of the water. Seriously, they could charge way more for these, and itd still be a steal. The craftsmanship is excellent they feel sturdy and well made. Yet, they fold up, which is a great feature as headphones of this style can be bulky. Despite the folding mechanisms, they arent delicate. I like that they are USB-C rechargeable, as I have plenty of those cables plugged in all around the house and at work. They connect easily right out of the box. The noice cancellation is almost too good. I was using them at work and engulfed in my computer. My co-worker was standing in the doorway way yelling to get my attention and I was totally oblivious. Fortunately you can easily toggle that feature off. Finally, the 3.5 mm jack is an unbelievably useful feature Id have never realized I needed but now cant live without. You can easily convert these bluetooth headphones to wired with the included cable. Long story short, these headphones rock, and if youre still reading this just buy them already.
